ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.5_0: The training rule on covering with rice
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their curry with rice because they wanted more. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1_0: ‘“I will not cover my curry or phrases with rice bean curry,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.4_0: he should not cover the various kinds of curry with rice because he wants more;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his curries with rice because he wants more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.10_0: if the owners cover it and then give;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.11_0: if it is not out of a desire for more;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.15_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
